skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Acolytes too are blessed by the Lady's spirit, enabling them to resist magical attacks.
Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Peasant Mob, Men-at-Arms, and Spearmen-at-Arms units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Peasant Mob, Men-at-Arms, and Spearmen-at-Arms units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even dull and stupid peasants can aim a bow, but with a little training they can learn to shoot with some success.

skillTree.localised_description: Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Mounted Yeomen, Knights Errant, Knights of the Realm, Questing Knights, Grail Knights, and Grail Guardians units

skillTree.localised_description: Those who serve the Lady purely are rewarded with a portion of her strength when battle is joined.

Speed: +6% for Pegasus Knights, Royal Pegasus Knights, and Royal Hippogryph Knights units

skillTree.localised_description: Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.

	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Field Trebuchet units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Field Trebuchet units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Field Trebuchet units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 15% for Peasant Mob, Men-at-Arms, Spearmen-at-Arms, Grail Reliquae, Battle Pilgrims, and Foot Squires units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Peasant Mob, Men-at-Arms, Spearmen-at-Arms, Grail Reliquae, Battle Pilgrims, and Foot Squires units (Rank 7 and above)

Armour: +12 for Peasant Mob, Men-at-Arms, Spearmen-at-Arms, Grail Reliquae, Battle Pilgrims, and Foot Squires units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are literally no opponents too great for them to face down. None.

Armour: +12 for Mounted Yeomen, Knights Errant, Knights of the Realm, Questing Knights, and Pegasus Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Mounted Yeomen, Knights Errant, Knights of the Realm, Questing Knights, and Pegasus Knights units (Rank 7 and above)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mounted Yeomen, Knights Errant, Knights of the Realm, Questing Knights, and Pegasus Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.

effects.description:
Ward save: 8% for Grail Knights, Grail Guardians, Royal Pegasus Knights, and Royal Hippogryph Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Grail Knights, Grail Guardians, Royal Pegasus Knights, and Royal Hippogryph Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Grail Knights, Grail Guardians, Royal Pegasus Knights, and Royal Hippogryph Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Mounted Yeomen Archers, and Field Trebuchet units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Peasant Bowmen, Mounted Yeomen Archers, and Field Trebuchet units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Mounted Yeomen Archers, and Field Trebuchet units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: In this age of blood and battle, intellect is an underrated gift.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "This victory is not mine alone, we all share in the glory."
"Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor - a champion?"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: -5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A calming presence can be a steadying hand… but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

"When the clarion call is sounded
	 I will ride out and fight in the name of Liege and Lady
	Whilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed
	 unto me will remain untainted by evil
	 Honour is all, Chivalry is all..."

"I set down my lance, symbol of duty
	I spurn those whom I love
	I relinquish all and take up the tools of my quest
	No obstacle will stand before me
	No plea for help shall find me waiting
	No moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle
	I give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek..."

"That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve
	 That which is sublime I will protect
	That which threatens I will destroy
	For my holy wrath will know no bounds..."
